column2: HAWAII DMV DRIVING TEST
Question Text
1. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
column6: quickly change speed or lane position.
column8: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.

column2: 2. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column8: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 3. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column6: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 4. Regulatory signs are:
5. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you, you should:
column4: slow down, provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle and stop.
column6: keep moving slowly, staying to the right side of the road.
column8: disregard the signal if there are other lanes available for the emergency vehicle.
column10: immediately come to a complete stop.

column2: 6. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column8: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column10: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.

column2: 7. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______ of your vehicle.
column6: only on the left and right side

column2: 8. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column6: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 9. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column6: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.

column2: 10. You notice a vehicle defect which may affect the safe operation of your vehicle. You should:
column6: correct the defect when you can afford it.
column8: not carry passengers until the defect is corrected.
column10: correct the defect as soon as possible.

column2: 11. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
12. Which of the following is a common cause of a traffic collisions?
13. As long as you don’t leave the road, you may legally pass a vehicle on the right:
column4: if you are on a two-lane, two-way road and the other vehicle is turning left.
column8: when you are turning into a one-way street with no oncoming traffic.

column2: 14. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
15. This sign means:
column4: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column6: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 16. When the highway you are driving on is divided by two solid yellow lines, you:
column4: may cross the yellow lines only to make a U-turn.
column6: may never cross the yellow lines.
column8: may cross the yellow lines only if there is no on-coming traffic.
column10: may cross the yellow lines only to make a left turn into a private road or a driveway.

column2: 17. Which shape is a yield sign?
18. What does this road sign indicate?
column8: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 19. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column6: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 20. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
22. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
23. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.
column6: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column6: Keep to the side indicated by the arrow

column2: 25. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: get off the road and check your tires.
column10: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 26. Alcohol causes:
27. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column10: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 28. When passing trucks, drivers of a small vehicle must be prepared for:
29. You are stopped behind other vehicles waiting at a stop sign. When the intersection is clear:
column4: you must proceed through the intersection without stopping again.
column6: you may follow the vehicle ahead without stopping again.
column8: you must stop again at the stop sign.
column10: you may proceed with caution through the intersection without stopping if there is no other traffic.

column2: 30. When an approaching driver at night blinds you by failing to dim their high beams, you should look:
column4: towards the right side of the road.
column6: straight down the middle of the road.
column8: None of the other answers is correct.
column10: towards the left side of the road.
